<h1 align="center">
  Brave Brochure Stater.
</h1>

## ðŸš€ Quick start

1.  **Clone template to get started**

2.  **Run Sanity Init**

    Navigate to studio and make a new sanity instance

    ```shell
    cd studio/
    sanity init
    ```

3.  **Deploy your graphql api**

    Navigate to studio and make a new sanity instance

    ```shell
    cd studio/
    sanity graphql deploy
    ```

4.  **Add some content**

Start your studio and add some damn content

note: you will need to add an image into the 'Share Graphic' section in SEO / Share Settings on Home Page

     ```shell
    cd studio/
    sanity start
    ```

5.  **Install Dependencies**

    ```shell
    cd web/
    yarn
    ```

6.  **Fire up gatsby**

    Add your details to .env.development and .env.production

    \_Note: See the EXAMPLE.ENV

    ```shell
    cd web/
    gatsby develop
    ```

## Branching (optional)

1.  **Create separate branch**

2.  **Export production dataset and import into staging dataset**

    ```shell
    cd studio/
    sanity dataset export production
    sanity dataset import production.tar.gz staging --replace
    ```

3.  **Switch dataset in sanity.json and env to staging**

4.  **Develop features**

5.  **Test Build locall**

6.  **Open a pull request This will show up in Gatsby cloud and give you a url that you can share with clients and / or internally.**

7.  **Switch your dataset back to production and redeploy your Graphql api**

8.  **Test build locally then push changes.**

## ðŸŽ“ Learning Gatsby

Looking for more guidance? Full documentation for Gatsby lives [on the website](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/). Here are some places to start:

- **For most developers, we recommend starting with our [in-depth tutorial for creating a site with Gatsby](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/tutorial/).** It starts with zero assumptions about your level of ability and walks through every step of the process.

- **To dive straight into code samples, head [to our documentation](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/).** In particular, check out the _Guides_, _API Reference_, and _Advanced Tutorials_ sections in the sidebar.
